An institute to support academic & community collaborations in the digital humanities
Hosted by the Institute for Digital Research in the Humanities
University of Kansas, Lawrence, KS
June 6-11, 2022

About

Hosted by the Institute for Digital Research in the Humanities at the University of Kansas, PDHI is intended to foster successful academic-community digital, public-facing humanities projects.

More â€º

Curriculum

The curriculum includes an intense week of case studies, technical training, and workshops & discussions intended to strengthen relationships, create sustainable projects, and provide foundational knowledge of tools and methods in the public digital humanities.

More â€º

Faculty

The Institute sessions will be led by more than 20 experienced academics and community partners, offering a breadth of complementary skill sets and areas of expertise that will provide participants rich opportunities for engagement.
